creator: sfhowes

content: Generally, reinstalling does not fix problems, but if you plan to reinstall, I suggest being extra safe. To do that, I suggest: - exit thunderbird - copy the profile elsewhere, whether to an external drive or to another place on disk. the profile is at c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird - reinstall thunderbird and exit - copy the saved profile thunderbird folder to c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming to overwrite the default thunderbird folder - restart thunderbird and everything will be there.
creator: davidsk

content: Your thunderbird addressbook is named abook.sqlite and can be imported at tools>import. Your gmail addressbook can be added at the addressbook menu and select to add a cardDAV addressbook. Then use your gmail address to set it up.
creator: davidsk

content: If you lost your password, I encourage you to contact your email provider to reset the password. Thunderbird has no ability provide new passwords.
creator: davidsk

content: All I can suggest is to omit the password. The login to a google account assumes (as I understand it) the password is an app password. Since what you entered is not, the login fails. If there is no password, google prompts for the id and then shows an 'allow' link to continue. That has been my experience and that approach has worked for many.
creator: davidsk

content: Check to be sure you did not check to save messages in the folder of the message being replied to. That option is in the 'copies&folder' pane. Other than that, I have no suggestions.
creator: davidsk

content: The simplest way I have found to match a csv with Thunderbird's preferences is this: - with at least one email address in the addressbook, export a csv from thunderbird. - this is now your template. View it in a spreadsheet program and compare to the csv file that you want to import. - adjust the columns in your csv to mirror the columns in the exported csv. - now the import should go smoothly.
creator: davidsk

content: Assicurati che tutte le cartelle di tuo interesse siano selezionate per la sincronizzazione -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/sincronizzazione-imap#w_configurazione-della-sincronizzazione-ed-utilizzo-dello-spazio-sul-disco

content: In the 'copies&folders' pane for an account, you can specify where sent messages are stored.
creator: davidsk

content: There is a temporary problem in the forum. I anticipate it will be fixed soon,
creator: davidsk

content: Check your online account to see if they are being received there. If they are, check the Thunderbird junk folder. If they are not found online, then your email provider is possibly rejecting them as spam. You might also check with senders to see if they receive messages about their emails not being sent.
creator: davidsk

content:
Hi,

I believe the only way to see that is to enable the "Find events page". To do that, please: Click the "Layout options" on your calendar (see the dark green arrow)

Then to control the period use the drop down (light green arrow) you can select it (next 7days for example) Please note that the events will be shown only in the "Find Events" area and will not reflect the calendar view.

I hope that helps. If you by any chance can't see the colors or the image, please let me know and I will add more description.
creator: shopov.bogomil
